predicate.note: Frames file for 'draw' based on sentences in financial subcorpus and comparison with Chris' old frames file. I can't believe it's taken me this long to redo this verb.

example.name: transitive
example.text: The only way you can make it a big deal is *trace* to draw linkages that just don't make sense.''
example.arg: linkages that just don't make sense

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: John drew a picture of a rose for Mary.

roleset.name: pull

example.name: all args
example.text: The dollar drew strength from the stock market's climb.

example.name: passive
example.text: An index of economic activity drawn *trace* from the survey...

example.name: ergative, with direction
example.text: As the London trading session drew to a close...

example.name: transitive with odd directional
example.text: DEC ``drew down its European backlog'' and had flat world-wide orders overall.

roleset.note: "draw down" seems to be a specific financial usage; I'm not sure what the exact meaning is.

roleset.name: brandish a weapon

example.name: violent tendencies
example.text: John drew a knife on Mary.

roleset.note: Note that this sentence can also be the 'art' sense, as seen by the addition of an instrument: John drew a knife on Mary with a purple marker.

roleset.name: art: compose

example.name: transitive
example.text: Mr. Freeman said machinists' union advisers plan *trace* to meet this week *trace* to try *trace* to draw up a blueprint for some form of recapitalization that could include a special dividend for shareholders, an employee stake and, perhaps, an equity investment by a friendly investor.
example.arg: a blueprint for some form of recapitalization that could include a special dividend for shareholders, an employee stake and, perhaps, an equity investment by a friendly investor

roleset.note: Except for the particle, identical to the "art" sense of "draw".

example.name: always 'alongside'?
example.text: John drew up alongside Mary in his customized hot-rod. And she laughed in his face.
